item.description: Qualities that lead to dispassion, not to passion Qualities to being unfettered, not to being fettered Qualities to shedding, not to accumulating Qualities to modesty, not to self-aggrandizement Qualities to contentment, not to discontent Qualities to seclusion, not to entanglement Qualities to aroused persistence, not to laziness Qualities to being unburdensome, not to being burdensome

item.title: 8 Worldy winds
item.description: The eight worldly phenomena that tend to make the heart tremble: 1. Gain 2. Loss 3. Respect 4. Contempt 5. Praise 6.

item.title: 8-Fold Middle Path
item.description: Right Understanding (samma ditthi) Right Thought (samma sankappa) Right Speech (samma vaca) Right Action (samma kammanta) Right Livelihood (samma ajiva) Right Effort (samma vayama) Right Mindfulness (samma sati) Right Concentration (samma samadhi) (from Samyutta Nikaya 12.

item.title: 9 abodes
item.description: Nine abodes: The [[7 stations of consciousness]] and: 8. The dimension of non-percipient beings 9. The dimension of neither perception nor non-perception (from Khp.

item.title: 9 Jhanas
item.description: (meditative absorptions, sometimes listed as the Four Jhanas and the formless realms): Delightful Sensations Joy Contentment Utter peacefulness Infinity of space Infinity of consciousness No-thingness Neither perception nor non-perception Cessation (from Anguttara Nikaya 9.

item.title: 9 Limbs
item.description: The nine divisions of the teachings: Discourses Teachings in verse Predictions Summaries in verse Dependent Origination Instructions by simile Quotations Inspired sayings Stories of previous births

item.title: 9 Nutriment of Knowledge and Liberation
item.description: Supreme knowledge and liberation have their nutriment: the seven factors of enlightenment. The seven factors of enlightenment have their nutriment: the four foundations of mindfulness.

item.title: 9 ways not to accept something as completely true
item.description: Do not believe in something just because it is reported Do not believe in something just because it is tradition or culture Do not believe in something just because it is hearsay Do not believe in something just because the authorities say it is so Do not believe in something just because it is in the scriptures Do not believe in something thinking a god inspired it Do not believe in something just by logic or inference alone Do not believe in something because of speculative opinion Do not believe in something just because your teacher says it is true (Help yourself, accept as completely true only that which you test for yourself, and know to be good for yourself and others.
